title: Marco Donadel
text:
Marco Donadel (born 21 April 1983) is a Italian <a href="Association%20football">football</a> coach and a former <a href="midfielder">midfielder</a>, currently working as assistant <a href="coach%20%28sports%29">coach</a> of the Russian club <a href="FC%20Spartak%20Moscow">Spartak Moscow</a>.
Club career.
Milan.
Donadel is a youth product of <a href="A.C.%20Milan">Milan</a>, playing for the <a href="A.C.%20Milan%20Primavera">youth side</a> between 1998 and 2002, winning the <a href="Torneo%20di%20Viareggio">Torneo di Viareggio</a> in 1999 and 2001, before being promoted to the senior side. On 4 March 2001, he made his debut for Milan, coming on as a substitute for <a href="Andres%20Guglielminpietro">Andres Guglielminpietro</a> at the 78th minute of a home Serie A game against <a href="Parma%20Calcio%201913">Parma</a>. The following season, he made his debut appearances in the <a href="UEFA%20Cup">UEFA Cup</a> and <a href="Coppa%20Italia">Coppa Italia</a>.
Having made just 4 appearances for the senior squad of Milan, Donadel was loaned out to <a href="U.S.%20Lecce">Lecce</a> in July 2002.
In June 2003 Donadel was sold to <a href="Parma%20F.C.">Parma</a> in a <a href="co-ownership%20%28football%29">co-ownership deal</a> for €2 million. (with 50% rights of <a href="Roberto%20Massaro">Roberto Massaro</a> was purchased by Milan for €2 million) The deal made Milan making a profit of €3.897 million. In June 2004 Milan bought back 50% rights of Donadel for €800,000 in a four-year contract (Milan booked the contract value of Donadel was €4 million instead of €1.6 million, thus receiving €1.2 million financial income instead of costing Milan to write down the value of retaining 50% registration rights for €1.2 million.) In 2004–05 season Donadel was loaned to <a href="U.C.%20Sampdoria">Sampdoria</a> for free and finally <a href="ACF%20Fiorentina">Fiorentina</a> in January 2005, for €200,000.
Fiorentina.
After a successful half-season long loan with Fiorentina, he was signed on a permanent basis for €1.2 million in a four-year contract. The deal also made Milan book a €1.8 million loss. as the residual value of Donadel's contract, after amortization, was €3 million. In 2005–06 he was a regular for coach <a href="Cesare%20Prandelli">Cesare Prandelli</a>, who had already appreciated the skills of Donadel, as they were together at Parma. In June 2007, he was offered a new contract which would last until June 2011.
Napoli.
On 24 June 2011, he signed a four-year contract with <a href="S.S.C.%20Napoli">Napoli</a>. During his stay with Napoli he only appeared in four league matches and during the 2013–14 season he was sent on loan to <a href="Hellas%20Verona%20F.C.">Verona</a> where he was a regular starter for the club.
Montreal Impact.
Once his loan spell with Verona concluded Donadel went on trial with <a href="Major%20League%20Soccer">Major League Soccer</a> side <a href="Montreal%20Impact%20%282012%E2%80%932020%29">Montreal Impact</a>. Donadel officially signed with the <a href="Montreal%20Impact%20%282012%E2%80%932020%29">Montreal Impact</a> on 1 December 2014. His 30-yard strike in a 3–0 home win against <a href="Columbus%20Crew%20SC">Columbus Crew</a>, on 11 July 2015, was voted <a href="2015%20Major%20League%20Soccer%20season%23Weekly%20awards">MLS goal of the week</a> for the 19th week of the <a href="2015%20Major%20League%20Soccer%20season">2015 MLS season</a>. On 25 October, he assisted one of <a href="Didier%20Drogba">Drogba's</a> goals as the Montreal Impact came from behind to defeat domestic rivals <a href="Toronto%20FC">Toronto FC</a> 2–1 at home; the win gave Montreal the home advantage for their knock-out fixture against Toronto in the <a href="2015%20MLS%20Cup%20Playoffs">2015 MLS Cup Playoffs</a>.
Donadel was waived by Montreal on 22 June 2018.
International career.
Donadel was the captain of <a href="Italy%20national%20under-21%20football%20team">Italy under-21 team</a> between 2004 and 2006, and won the 2004 <a href="European%20Under-21%20Football%20Championship">European Under-21 Football Championship</a>, totalling 31 appearances and 1 goal. Donadel also won a bronze medal with Italy at the <a href="2004%20Summer%20Olympics">2004 Summer Olympics</a> <a href="Football%20at%20the%202004%20Summer%20Olympics">football tournament</a>.
Coaching career.
On 17 December 2021, Donadel was announced as the new assistant coach of <a href="FC%20Spartak%20Moscow">Spartak Moscow</a>, following the appointment of <a href="Paolo%20Vanoli">Paolo Vanoli</a> as the club's new head coach.
